|Extension|Author|Version|

|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.0.18|

1. Open a markdown file.
2. Ctrl K V to open preview
3. Scroll the md source without clicking on content. 
Preview doesn't scroll. If I scroll with cursor, it scrolls fine.

data.title: The CSS property "hyphens" is not recognised.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
```
Version 1.9.0
Commit 27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af
Date 2017-02-02T08:21:13.228Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
```
- OS Version:
```Linux  4.9.6-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Thu Jan 26 09:22:26 CET 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Define a CSS rule which contains the `hyphens` property.
Example :
```CSS
.text-break {
  -webkit-hyphens: auto;
  -ms-hyphens: auto;
  -moz-hyphens: auto;
  hyphens: auto;
}
```
2. The W3 standards property `hyphens` will receive an `Unknown property.` warning.

![vscode-hyphens-unknown-css-property](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22870070/22603399/7ff6adee-ea47-11e6-8488-13e3af5b1853.png)

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Add openRecentFolder telemetry
Can't find the \r caracter with the new VS Code 1.9 Update
data.body:
With the new VS Code 1.9, you change the Regexp Handling method that we cannot only replace OR find « \r » character, because now it's only the « \n » character that it's used.

How do i can distinguish \r in \r\n in the file now ?

data.title: Request: Shortcut to send the current line to the terminal
data.body:
Some other apps handle "send to console"-like features like this:

1. if no text is selected, send the current line (and maybe move the cursor to the next line)
2. if some text is selected, send that text

VSCode currently provides a way to achieve 2 but not (easily) 1 or 1+2 depending on the current selection.

VSCode should provide at least some command to send the current line (and move to the next line).

data.title: Tasks won't run if User Settings file has no settings after updating to 1.9.0
data.body:
Tasks that ran before the 1.9.0 update weren't after updating. I discovered that they resumed working after I defined a setting in User Settings. I usually keep my settings in Workspace and User Settings had been empty other than the default comment:

// Place your settings in this file to overwrite the default settings

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home v1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Update to VSCode 1.9.0
2. Have no settings defined in User Settings.
3. Tasks that ran before updating to 1.9.0 will no longer run.
4. Define a User Setting, such as "editor.renderWhitespace": "none"
5. Tasks resume working.

Tasks don't run or produce any message in the output window. The same commands can be run manually from the VSCode terminal, so I don't believe it was a PATH problem.

data.body: I would love for the tabs in VSCode to work like google chrome with the ability to tear them off and also for you to move them to another window.

data.title: Using SnippetString in CompletionItem
data.body:
I'm working on a language server, and have `vscode-languageserver-types@3.0.3` as dep. However, it doesn't have `SnippetString` and doesn't allow `SnippetString` as part of `CompletionItem.insertText`.

I thought LS servers wouldn't have to have `vscode` as a dev dep -- at least that's what I gathered from the node LS and html LS.

However I was looking at #15573 and it seems Go just depends directly on VSCode: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/blob/master/src/goSuggest.ts#L187

Two questions:

- Will `SnippetString` be added to `vscode-languageserver-types`?
- Overall, should LS servers import types from `vscode` or `vscode-languageserver-types`?

/cc @dbaeumer @jrieken

data.title: Threads window is not updated after each call to threadsRequest()
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Linux x64

The threads display is not being correctly updated after a call to `threadsRequest()`.

I'm working on adding multi-threading support to the Android debugging extension and after the initial call, I'm finding that the threads shown in the UI rarely correspond to the return values from the call to `threadsRequest()`. In particular, newly created threads are not displayed and deleted threads remain even though they are no longer in the `ThreadsResponse` body.

This may be related to the ongoing thread-handling discussion in #40 but this does appear to be a distinct problem in the current build.

data.title: Focus Next and Prev Search Result current position lost if the text is edited.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Search for a string using the search pane.
2. Press F4 several times to go to a particular result.
3. Edit the text so it no longer matches the search term, and is thus removed from the results in the search pane.
4. Press F4 to go to the next result.

Expected Result:
The next result is highlighted.  (This is the behavior in Visual Studio.)

Actual Result:
The first result is highlighted.  F4 must be used several times to get back to the desired result.

data.title: Focus Next and Prev Search Result don't wrap around
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search for a string in the search pane.
2. Use F4 to go to the next result.
3. Once the last result is reached, the key stops working, instead of wrapping around as in Visual Studio.

The same applies to Shift-F4 to go backwards.  This functionality in VS is incredibly useful to go to the last match in a file.

data.title: Cannot debug unit tests
data.body:
* Change launch.json in VSCode repo to:
```
			"args": [
				"--timeout",
				"999999",
				"--run",
				"out\\vs\\editor\\contrib\\find\\test\\common\\findModel.test.js"
			],
```
* Put a breakpoint in findModel.test.ts
* Launch unit tests

Obseve:
```
C:\Programs\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\Code - Insiders.exe --inspect=41198 --debug-brk node_modules\mocha\bin\_mocha --timeout 999999 --run out\vs\editor\contrib\find\test\common\findModel.test.js 
Inspector support is not available with this Node.js build
C:\Programs\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\Code - Insiders.exe: bad option: --inspect=41198
```

data.title: Focus Next Search Result doesn't work due to keyboard shortcut conflict
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

F4 to go to the next search result doesn't work when the focus is in the text editor due to this shortcut key:

```
{ "key": "f4",                    "command": "C_Cpp.SwitchHeaderSource",
                                     "when": "editorTextFocus" },
```

The workaround is to re-add the shortcut in the user settings.

```
{
    "key": "f4",
    "command": "search.action.focusNextSearchResult",
    "when": "editorTextFocus"
}
```

data.title: html.format.wrapAttributes: value is "force-aligned", not "force-align"
data.body:
A new option for the html formatter got added in January.
The schema for the html.format.wrapAttributes setting uses "force-align". Should be "force-aligned".

data.title: Tasks/Integrated Terminal not picking up User Path
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows 7

It seems like VS Code is not inheriting the user level PATH in Windows 7. System level PATH is working fine.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run a shell command from either a task or integrated terminal
2. If the target is defined in User Path, "* is not recognized as an internal or exsternal command, operable program or batch file."

Anyone else having this behavior? Is it intended? It's been a few weeks since I was actively using VS Code, so I'm not sure exactly when this started happening, but it wasn't an issue before...

data.title: Reindent lines in 1.9 – feedback
data.body:
VSCode 1.9 introduced initial support for line indenting as [per the release notes](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_9#_indentation-rules-improvements), I think it's this commit: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/be1b5f75161a30dd63316b832067b41d2caec0b3. I'm very interested in this feature, big 👍 for bringing it into VSCode.

Here is some initial feedback:

- I tried for a couple of file formats, it only worked for TypeScript and not e.g., for JSON or PHP.
- Formatting (`Alt+Shift+F`) can already do indentation better than the new implementation, maybe it could be used as a fallback if the language doesn't have proper indentation rules.
- If I read the code correctly, it re-indents the whole file. It should respect my selection. For example, if I have only 10 lines selected, it should re-indent those. If I don't have any selection, it should do the whole file.
- The command is currently `editor.action.reindentlines`, proper casing would be `editor.action.reindentLines`.

data.title: .NET Core Debugging stopped working in Visual Studio Code 1.9
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

I've updated to visual studio code 1.9 and suddenly I can't debug my .NET Core Application. If I look into the launch.json it says the "type: coreclr" is not accepted. I've left my config file below.

Thanks in advance :-)

```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": ".NET Core Launch (web)",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "launch",
            "preLaunchTask": "build",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\bin\\Debug\\netcoreapp1.1\\BUnity.dll",
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "internalConsoleOptions": "openOnSessionStart",
            "launchBrowser": {
                "enabled": true,
                "args": "${auto-detect-url}",
                "windows": {
                    "command": "cmd.exe",
                    "args": "/C start ${auto-detect-url}"
                },
                "osx": {
                    "command": "open"
                },
                "linux": {
                    "command": "xdg-open"
                }
            },
            "env": {
                "ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT": "Development"
            },
            "sourceFileMap": {
                "/Views": "${workspaceRoot}/Views"
            }
        },
        {
            "name": ".NET Core Attach",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "processId": "${command.pickProcess}"
        },
         {
            "name": ".NET Core Launch (console)",
            "type": "coreclr",
            "request": "launch",
            "preLaunchTask": "build",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\bin\\Debug\\netcoreapp1.1\\BUnity.dll",
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "internalConsoleOptions": "openOnSessionStart",
            "env": {
                "ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT": "Development"
            },
            "sourceFileMap": {
                "/Views": "${workspaceRoot}/Views"
            }
        }
    ]
}

```

data.title: [ux] Change how files are staged in Git view
data.body:
Right now, the process for staging files in the git view involve me clicking the plus button along each file's name. This creates some problems if the list is too long, as the pane's scroll position keeps jumping here and there, and user cannot keep his mouse stable in one place and keep clicking the `+` button. They have to individually seek out each file they want to stage, and then click the button, otherwise they end up staging wrong files.

Observe:
![bug1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/760112/22594551/7c8137f4-ea49-11e6-8bdf-d06b36122c29.gif)

vs

Git GUI
![bug2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/760112/22594610/d218939c-ea49-11e6-8eaf-7fce3110788a.gif)

data.title: Toggle word wrap no longer works in 1.9
data.body:
Used to be able to toggle word wrap on and off with alt-z and changing "editor.wordWrap": to either true or false manually has no effect either.

It seems the only way to change the wrapping is to update the settings and change "editor.wrappingColumn" to -1 (for no wrap) and anything else for wrapping

- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:21:13.228Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-59-generic

|---|---|---|

|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|0.0.12|
|phpcs|ikappas|0.7.0|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. press alt-z or change editor.wordWrap to true or false
2. only way to switch off wrapping is to set editor.wrappingColumn to -1

data.title: Node debug Step Over/Into hangs in 1.9
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set a breakpoint and start debugging node process
2. After breakpoint is hit, just try to Step Over (F10) or Step Into (F11) and both will hang. However, if you set a breakpoint on the next line, and do Continue (F5), it'll continue.

This did not happen in 1.8.1 but started happening right after 1.9.

data.title: Intellisense freezes at random instances
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0 / 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows

---
> **Tested on 4 different machines running Windows 10/Windows 10/Linux/macOS**

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write code in * language
2. Observe lack of intellisense 

![prob2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9406520/22594060/26c60016-ea2a-11e6-935b-dbe44ff8b441.gif)

data.title: Unable to execute Python Scripts from VS Code via Powershell
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|sublime-keybindings|ms-vscode|1.8.2|
|vscode-sql-beautify|sensourceinc|0.0.4|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a python script
2. Execute it on the integrated terminal

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22213964/22593029/ab3f2ea4-ea42-11e6-88fe-f68145ba9eea.png)

The script is executed as `"python" c:/path/scriptname.py` when it should be `python c:/path/scriptname.py` (without the double quotes around the word python).

I don't know if there is a system setting to change how VS Code passes commands to powershell in this case, hence the bug report.

data.title: Extensions update button missing
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on Extensions
2. Show Extensions 

If there is an update for an extension I have to click through each extension to see which I can update. In the past versions of Visual Studio Code there was an update button right inside the list view of the installed extensions to update them.

I attached a picture to show you what I mean I hope this makes the issue clearer:

![bildschirmfoto 2017-02-03 um 13 59 05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17197786/22592238/fd831baa-ea18-11e6-8164-f1ad2c80ada3.png)
